page.title: 13BY_PASS THROUGH HARNHAM
page.content: There is much discussion about the extension of the Salisbury by-pass system. Environmental problems, congestion, safety considerations have made this necessary. Two routes have been considered. A northern route will run from Harnham northwards via Laverstock & the Woodford Valley, to link the A36,A30,A345 & A360. A southern route which is slightly shorter will start from the A36 west of Salisbury, pass through south Harnham, link with the A354 & A338 and rejoin the A36 east of the City. There will be damage to the environment whichever route is chosen.
